Package interactions

Class StaticMenu

java.lang.Object
interactions.Interaction
interactions.UserMenu
interactions.StaticMenu
public final class StaticMenu extends UserMenu
Represents user menus where the dependencies and behaviours are defined at compile time. Since the code logic will be the same for all static menus, all menus that are static will be instances of this class. See CamsInteraction, where all static choices and static menus are defined.

  • Constructor Details

    • StaticMenu

      public StaticMenu(String title, List<MenuChoice> choice, Interaction back)
      Since choices and the message is statically defined, they will be required to initialise an instance of this class
      Parameters:
      title - the message to be printed at the top before choices are given
      choice - the list of choices offered
      back - the interaction to return to when the user chooses to go back

  • Method Details

    • populate

      protected void populate(String currentuser, Scanner s, Controller control)
      Description copied from class: UserMenu
      The function called to populate the list of choices.

      The general format of run is populate, givechoices, set tags. This function makes it easier to define what the menu does.

      Specified by:
      populate in class UserMenu
      Parameters:
      currentuser - the current user
      s - the scanner used for the app
      control - the container for each of the five active control implementation instances

    • run

      public final Interaction run(String currentuser, Scanner s, Controller control) throws UserInfoMissingException, MissingRequestedDataException
      Description copied from class: Interaction
      Function to be run
      Specified by:
      run in class Interaction
      Parameters:
      currentuser - the id of the current user
      s - the scanner used for the entire app
      control - the controller which contains all the control implementations
      Returns:
      the result of the run
      Throws:
      UserInfoMissingException - if the user id of the current user cannot be found
      MissingRequestedDataException - if the function requested data from the controller or Data, and it was invalid or missing.
